definition: suffix of a noun of locality

sentences.english: Sea LanZhu coma lying in bed, defends huang taiji in the bedside old a lot.
sentences.chinese: 海兰珠一直昏迷躺在床上，皇太极守在床边苍老不少。

sentences.english: A lamp that's easy to turn on and a phone by your bed may be helpful.
sentences.chinese: 床边安一盏开关方便的灯，一部电话会很有帮助。

sentences.english: He had taken a chair and had sat down by the bed, leaning one arm on the coverlet .
sentences.chinese: 他搬了一把椅子，坐到床边，把一只胳膊搁在被子上。

sentences.english: Mrs Heathcliff was seated by the bedside, with her hands folded on her knees.
sentences.chinese: 希刺克厉夫夫人坐在床边，手抱着膝。

sentences.english: Why keep aspirin by your bedside?
Keep mask in my coat pocket, humidifier by my bed.
sentences.chinese: 外套口袋里备有口罩，床边备有空气加湿器。

sentences.english: I left the lantern outside and went near to his bed.
sentences.chinese: 我把提灯留在门外，自己走到他的床边。

sentences.english: Keep a notepad at your bedside along with a gentle night-light and pen.
sentences.chinese: 床边放一个小记事本，一盏柔和的夜明灯和一支笔。

sentences.english: I dreamed that I was inside a hospital room. I was wearing a hospital gown and I was sitting at the foot of my bed.
sentences.chinese: 我梦到我在一家医院，穿着病号服坐在床边。

sentences.english: At his father's bedside, Fan Dachong, the eldest son, promised he would look after the books.
sentences.chinese: 在父亲的床边，范答铳，长子，许诺他会看的书籍。

sentences.english: She tiptoed to the bedside of the child.
sentences.chinese: 她跷着脚走到孩子的床边。

sentences.english: She tiptoed to the bed where the child lay asleep.
sentences.chinese: 孩子睡着了，她踮着脚走到他床边。

sentences.english: The moment Catherine left Mr Linton's room, she appeared at my bedside.
sentences.chinese: 凯瑟琳一离开林惇先生的屋子，就出现在我的床边。

sentences.english: On the small table near his bed he saw another piece of paper.
sentences.chinese: 在床边小桌迷了路，他看见另一张纸。

sentences.english: On the left of the door, you'll find a bed with a small table beside it.
sentences.chinese: 在门左边，你会找到一张床，床边有张小桌子。

sentences.english: For two months, I spent every day sitting by his bedside.
sentences.chinese: 两个月来我每天守在他床边。

definition: sofa (loanword)/CL:條|条[tiao2],張|张[zhang1]/(Internet slang) the first reply or replier to a forum post
(to move or do sth) softly and quietly (idiom)
